Body:
I am using IOT on a rpi3 to fire up a browser what I need to do is add a parameter so that I can run the same image with slightly modified behaviour instead of having to produce multiple images. I was wondering if it is possible to fire the app and pass a simple parameter Something like -

C:\Data\Users\administrator\Documents>IoTStartup add headed App[parameter]

and then pick up the parameter in the c# application

As far as I know, it is impossible to fire the app via passing a simple parameter like your mentions,please see Windows 10 IoT Core Command Line. But I think there is another way to satisfy your needs
column9: you can use a configuration file saved with your parameter data
column10: when you want to change the 	 behavior
column11:
you just need to modify the config file.So that you can use a same image.Please refer to this article(Store and retrieve settings and other app data).

"

Body: Good call, came up with a similar methodology using text file(the app doesn't have a config as such) but originally was looking at ip addresses and have even considered machine name as I am looking for the same functionality with the addition of a location (as you see from above passing that into the IoTStartup would be a way of differentiation)
